content:
There are many species of catfish that are not native to Africa. Some examples include:

1. Channel catfish (Ictalurus punctatus): This is a popular species for aquaculture and sport fishing in North America. It is known for its excellent flavor and is a common ingredient in fish stews, soups, and fried fish dishes.
2. Blue catfish (Ictalurus furcatus): A large freshwater species also found in North America, it is valued for its good flavor and high quality meat, as well as for its potential to grow up to 45 kg in some cases.
3. Flathead catfish (Pylodictis olivaris): It is also found in North America, and it's known for its large size, with individuals weighing over 50 kg.
4. European catfish (Silurus glanis): It's native to Europe, This species can grow very large, and individuals over 2m in length and over 120 kg in weight have been reported.
5. Redtail catfish (Phractocephalus hemioliopterus): found in South America, known to be a large species with an impressive size and color.
6. Mekong giant catfish (Pangasianodon gigas): It is a species of catfish in the shark catfish family, and it's one of the largest freshwater fish in the world, found in the Mekong River in Southeast Asia, it can grow up to 3m in length and weigh up to 300kg.

These are some examples of non-African catfish species. Keep in mind that this is not an exhaustive list and there are many other species of catfish found throughout the world.
